verses.text: These are the leaders of the Israelites—the heads of families, the commanders of thousands and hundreds, and the officers who served the king—who oversaw all matters of the divisions that rotated service, month by month, throughout the year. Each division consisted of twenty-four thousand.
verses.comment: Clarifies the structure of army divisions described in the original Hebrew.

verses.text: Over the first division for the first month was Jashobeam son of Zabdiel, and there were twenty-four thousand in his division.
verses.comment: Names match the Hebrew. Number of men preserved for accuracy.

verses.text: He was a descendant of Perez and led all the commanders of the army assigned for the first month.
verses.comment: Clarifies lineage. "The chief of all the commanders" simplified for readability.

verses.text: Over the division for the second month was Dodai the Ahohite, and his division's chief officer was Mikloth; twenty-four thousand served in his division.
verses.comment: Some manuscripts list 'Eleazar' instead of Dodai, but Dodai is original; note kept implicit.

verses.text: Over the third division for the third month was Benaiah son of Jehoiada, the chief priest; twenty-four thousand served in his division.
verses.comment: "Chief priest" rendered as "leader"—clarifies his priestly status and military command.

verses.text: This Benaiah was a mighty warrior among the thirty and was over the thirty; his division's leader was Ammizabad, his son.
verses.comment: ‘Thirty’ refers to elite warriors. Family relationship emphasized.

verses.text: Over the fourth division for the fourth month was Asahel, Joab’s brother, and after him was Zebadiah his son; twenty-four thousand served in his division.
verses.comment: Asahel listed first, then Zebadiah after Asahel’s death—original context implied.

verses.text: The fifth division for the fifth month was commanded by Shamhuth the Izrahite; twenty-four thousand served in his division.
verses.comment: Name matches Hebrew. "Izrahite" preserved despite variant readings.

verses.text: The sixth division for the sixth month was led by Ira son of Ikkesh the Tekoite; twenty-four thousand served in his division.
verses.comment: ‘Tekoite’ is retained for birthplace/geographic accuracy.

verses.text: The seventh division for the seventh month was under Helez the Pelonite; twenty-four thousand served in his division.
verses.comment: ‘Pelonite’ rendered as in main Hebrew text; some versions have ‘Paltite’.

verses.text: The eighth division for the eighth month was commanded by Sibbecai the Hushathite; twenty-four thousand served in his division.
verses.comment: ‘Hushathite’ kept for proper identification.

verses.text: The ninth division for the ninth month was overseen by Abiezer the Anathothite; twenty-four thousand served in his division.
verses.comment: ‘Anathothite’ denotes origin from Anathoth; maintained.

verses.text: The tenth division for the tenth month was led by Maharai the Netophathite; twenty-four thousand served in his division.
verses.comment: ‘Netophathite’ included for geographical accuracy.

verses.text: The eleventh division for the eleventh month was commanded by Benaiah the Pirathonite; twenty-four thousand served in his division.
verses.comment: ‘Pirathonite’ kept as in original; Pirathon is location.

verses.text: The twelfth division for the twelfth month was under Heldai the Netophathite, from Othniel; twenty-four thousand served in his division.
verses.comment: ‘The Netophathite, from Othniel’ rendered for clarity—original Hebrew is slightly ambiguous.

verses.text: Over the tribes of Israel: for Reuben, Eliezer son of Zichri was leader; for Simeon, Shephatiah son of Maacah;
verses.comment: Intro to chiefs over tribes; verse split preserved.

verses.text: for Levi, Hashabiah son of Kemuel; for Aaron, Zadok;
verses.comment: Aaron treated separately from Levi as in original; Zadok as priestly leader.

verses.text: for Judah, Elihu, one of David's brothers; for Issachar, Omri son of Michael;
verses.comment: Elihu’s identification as David’s brother is original.

verses.text: for Zebulun, Ishmaiah son of Obadiah; for Naphtali, Jerimoth son of Azriel;
verses.comment: Names and lineage retained from Hebrew text.

verses.text: for Ephraim, Hoshea son of Azaziah; for the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joel son of Pedaiah;
verses.comment: Half-tribe designation clarified from context.

verses.text: for the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo son of Zechariah; for Benjamin, Jaasiel son of Abner;
verses.comment: Distinguishes the two portions of Manasseh, as in original.

verses.text: for Dan, Azarel son of Jeroham. These were the leaders of the tribes of Israel.
verses.comment: Concludes the listing of tribal chiefs.

verses.text: David did not count those who were twenty years old and younger, for the LORD had said He would multiply Israel like the stars of heaven.
verses.comment: Explicit reason for decision connected to God’s promise (Genesis cross-referenced).

verses.text: Joab son of Zeruiah began to count them, but he did not finish. Wrath came upon Israel because of this numbering, and the final count was not recorded in the official chronicles of King David.
verses.comment: Clarifies narrative about the census and its consequences.

verses.text: Azmaveth son of Adiel was in charge of the king’s treasuries; Jonathan son of Uzziah was over the storehouses in the fields, cities, villages, and towers.
verses.comment: Distinct duties outlined for clarity.

verses.text: Ezri son of Chelub managed those who worked the farmland.
verses.comment: ‘That worked the farmland’ clarified from Hebrew.

verses.text: Shimei the Ramathite was in charge of the vineyards; Zabdi the Shiphmite oversaw the produce of the vineyards for the wine cellars.
verses.comment: Two positions related to vineyard and wine clarified.

verses.text: Baal-hanan the Gederite was in charge of the olive and sycamore trees in the lowlands; Joash supervised the supplies of olive oil.
verses.comment: ‘Lowlands’ reflects the Hebrew ‘Shephelah’ area.

verses.text: Shitrai the Sharonite was in charge of the cattle in Sharon; Shaphat son of Adlai managed the cattle in the valleys.
verses.comment: Distinguishes herds by geography as in original.

verses.text: Obil the Ishmaelite was in charge of the camels; Jehdeiah the Meronothite managed the donkeys.
verses.comment: ‘Ishmaelite’ and ‘Meronothite’ retained per Hebrew.

verses.text: Jaziz the Hagrite was in charge of the flocks. All these officials oversaw King David’s property.
verses.comment: ‘Flocks’ (sheep and goats) simplified for readability.

verses.text: Jonathan, David’s uncle, served as advisor—a man of understanding and a scribe. Jehiel son of Hacmoni attended the king’s sons.
verses.comment: "Advisor" encompasses "counselor and scribe" from the Hebrew.

verses.text: Ahithophel was the king’s counselor; Hushai the Arkite was the king’s friend.
verses.comment: "Friend" translates the Hebrew for trusted confidant.

verses.text: After Ahithophel came Jehoiada son of Benaiah and Abiathar. Joab was commander of the king’s army.
verses.comment: Chronicles order of counselors and military chief—matches original ending.
